channel.title: Programming course at uni
channel.description: Hey everyone, it's my first year at uni and I'm doing a basic programming subject calle programing fundamentals and it's all about java, swapping integral values etc nothing too complicated , could anyone give some insights into at what links I should look at to study, and maybe some advice? :)

item.title: Programming course at uni
item.dc:creator: @runerunerune runerunerune
item.description:
@runerunerune wrote:

could a java expert please go on the website: respond.cc and type in session key 23974, and explain to me the answer, its a practice test that is the same as the real test , i dont get results back on the practice test so i dont know if i’m doing it correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming course at uni
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Pwnd:

I had a teaher fail me for some of the home works because I didn’t do it the way she wanted us to do it at that moment… loL

Same. I’m in an intro to programming course teaching us python. I get alot of marks off because I don’t do shit the way he wants.

Read full topic

item.title: Programming course at uni
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

runerunerune:

Hey everyone, it’s my first year at uni and I’m doing a basic programming subject calle programing fundamentals and it’s all about java, swapping integral values etc nothing too complicated , could anyone give some insights into at what links I should look at to study, and maybe some advice?

Probably what they give you to read. You could make your own game to show your professor, but if he’s got a stick in his ass, he’ll fail you because you didn’t complete the assignments.

With that in mind though, reading the java trails would be a good start. Effective Java as well.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Have you considered studying your textbook?

Read full topic
